title: Sri Lanka schedules power cuts of over two hours for June 10
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will undergo scheduled power cuts of up to 2 hours and 15 minutes on June 10, Public Utilities Commission (PUCSL) Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said.
All areas (A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, and W) will have power cuts of two hours nd 15 minutes between 8.30 am and 9.45 pm.
The Colombo city centre could face a power cut of three hours between 6.00 am and 8.15 am.
On June 11 and 12, one-hour power cut will be implemented in areas under A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, and W between 5.30 pm and 9.30 pm.
Between 6.00 am and 7.00 am, the Colombo city centre could face a power cut of one hour.
The state-run Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said the supply interruption time and restoration time will vary between 30 minutes and the times indicted above.
